Instance.description: The Fish object. This holds information that is specific to a fish such as the fish bowl VFX name, the weight range, etc.

TunableList.name: buffs_on_catch
TunableList.description: A list of buffs to award the Sim when they catch this fish.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableTuple.name: catch_multiplier
TunableTuple.description: The catch multiplier used if this fish is added to an object's fishing data through gameplay. If the fish is added to the fishing data through tuning, it will use the weight tuned in the fishing data instead of this one.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TdescFragTag.name: catchable_tests
TdescFragTag.description: If these tests pass, the Sim can catch this fish. If these tests fail, the Sim can not catch this fish. This doesn't stop the Sim from trying to catch these fish, but it will never happen. DO NOT add bait buffs here. Those should be added to the Required Bait tunable field. When testing on fishing skill be sure to enable 'Use Effective Skill Level' since baits can change it.

Tunable.name: fish_type
Tunable.description: The asm parameter for the size of the fish. If you're unsure what this should be set to, talk to the animator or modeler and ask what fish type this fish should be.

Tunable.name: fishbowl_vfx
Tunable.description: The name of the VFX to use when this fish is dropped in a fish bowl.

Tunable.name: fishing_hole_vfx
Tunable.description: The name of the VFX to use at the fishing hole (pond) where this fish can be caught.

Tunable.name: fishing_spot_vfx
Tunable.description: The name of the VFX to use at the fishing spot (sign) where this fish can be caught.

TunableList.name: global_policy_value_mapping
TunableList.description: The mapping of global policies that when enacted are used to increment the base value of the fish by a percent of its original value.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The global policy that when completed updates the cost of the fish by the paired percent.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The percent of the fish's value to increment the base value.

TunableList.name: inventory_to_fish_vfx
TunableList.description: The inventory type to fish vfx to play when fish is placed in inventory type. If inventory type does not exist in mapping, use fishbowl_vfx as fallback vfx to play.

TunableTuple.name: luck_option_config
TunableTuple.description: Luck specific data for this fish. When this fish is used as a possible option in fishing while using Luck, for example, we will use this data to help determine which fish to pick. Note that if the fish is added to the fishing data through tuning, we will use the luck option config defined there instead of this one.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

Tunable.name: mean_weight_deviation
Tunable.description: This is the amount of deviation from the mean the weight can be. The mean weight is first decided then multiplied by this number. The result is both added and subtracted from the mean weight to get the min/max possible weight of the fish. We then pick a random number between the min and max to determine the final weight of the fish. Example: Assume Mean Weight = 2 and Mean Weight Deviation = 0.2 2 x 0.2 = 0.4 min = 2 - 0.4 = 1.6 max = 2 + 0.4 = 2.4 A random number is chosen between 1.6 and 2.4, inclusively.

TunableVariant.name: required_bait_buff
TunableVariant.description: The bait buff that is required to catch this fish. If this is tuned, this fish can not be caught without the required bait. If this is not tuned, this fish can be caught with or without bait. Note: Bait buffs are the only buffs that should be tuned here. If you want to gate this fish on a non-bait buff, use the Catchable Tests.

TunableList.name: skill_weight_curve
TunableList.description: This curve represents the mean weight in kg of the fish based on the Sims's fishing skill level. The X axis is the Sim's effective fishing skill level. The Y axis is the mean weight, in kg, of the fish. The mean weight will be modified by the Mean Weight Deviation field.

Tunable.name: wall_mounted_object
Tunable.description: When this fish is mounted to the wall, this is the object it will turn in to.

Tunable.name: weight_money_multiplier
Tunable.description: The weight of the fish will be multiplied by this number then the result of that multiplication will be added to the base value of the fish.
